he also has a real name he wrote an article uh that was pretty seminal at the time really called

wouldn't check how much input it was getting from a user or from another system
uh or from somewhere else and it would try and stuff it into a memory location that um was too small um and how then

to this day viruses and worms largely still rely on on something along

so um with hacking on the rise uh companies do start defending themselves so uh what do they do well the classic

the explanation will separate the soft squishy internal network that has
no security from the big bad internet um and so let's stick a firewall in between um a lot of companies

some of it worked somewhere didn't work for other companies

the they were a little bit overly trigger happy and would tell you lots of things that were wrong that weren't
